description:
Demolition of the existing rear addition to gymnasium
building in connection with the conversion and extensions of
the main Public House building, to provide No.2 two bedroom
flats; conversion and addition of gymnasium building to
provide No.2 two bedroom houses and conversion and addition
to existing cottage building at the rear plus associated
landscaping works.
As shown on drawing numbers GS200625/100/A, L350/01B and 02B
and photographic record.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - All new external work shall be carried out in materials that resemble, as closely as possible, in colour and texture those of the existing building, unless otherwise specified in the approved application.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details [by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development] [, prior to the occupation for the permitted use of the development or any phase of the development], whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies EN15 [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 4 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation. a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case,
Condition : 5 - Before the use commences, sound insulation shall be provided for the building in accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved by the Council.

Condition : 6 - Details of the construction of the basement levels and
    associated measures to ensure protection of those
    neighbouring properties shall be submitted and approved in
    writing by the Local Planning Authority before that part of
    the development commences. The approved details shall be
    implemented and subsequently maintained throughout the
    duration of the development.

Condition : 7 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order, no development within Part 1 (Classes A-H) of Schedule 2 of that Order shall be carried out without the grant of planning permission having first been obtained from the Council.

Condition : 8 - Details of the unbuilt areas, boundary walls and fences or
    other means of enclosures shall be submitted to and approved
    in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the
    development hereby permitted is commenced and such details
    as approved shall be completed before any of the residential
    units are occupied.

Condition : 9 - The flat roof areas shall not be used as roof terraces,
    balcony or sitting out areas unless otherwise agreed in
    writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 10 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN21, EN22, and EN31 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN15 and EN35 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policy EN15 and EN35 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To ensure that the use can be accomodated without detriment
    to the amenity of the surrounding premises by reason of
    noise in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of
    policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.
Condition : 15 - In order to protect the amenities of the area.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to prevent
    over development of the site by controlling proposed
    extensions and alterations in order to ensure compliance
    with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - In order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details
    of the approved scheme and to protect the character and
    appearance of the Conservation Area.

Condition : 18 - In order to protect the amenity of the occupants of
    neighbouring properties in terms of privacy and overlooking.

Condition : 19 - You are advised that Listed Building consent should be
    sought and obtained in respect to the proposed internal/
    external alterations to the existing Class A3 use on the
    ground floor.

Condition : 20 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 21 - Details of the means by which the existing trees on the site
    are to be protected from damage by vehicles, stored or
    stacked supplies, waste or other materials, and building
    plant or other equipment shall be submitted to and approved
    by the Local Planning Authority before any work is begun,
    and such protection shall be installed and retained
    throughout the period of the works.

Condition : 22 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun before details
    of the arrangement for the storing of refuse or waste for
    all the properties have been submitted to and approved by
    the Local Planning Authority and the development shall not
    be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any
    approval given.

Condition : 23 - In order to ensure that those trees being retained are
    protected from machinery and building works during
    construction.

Condition : 24 - In order to ensure the satisfactory storage of refuse in
    order to ensure the amenity of future occupiers of the
    development and neighbouring occupiers in terms of smells
    and loose litter.
